title: Excel CONCAT Function

metadata.description: Learn about Excel CONCAT Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Excel CONCAT Function

CONCAT Function
To concatenate is to link something together
content_sections.content:
.
CONCAT is a function in Excel and is short for concatenate.
The
CONCAT
function is used to link multiple cells without adding any delimiters between the combined cell values.

content_sections.title: It is typed
content_sections.content:
=CONCAT
=CONCAT(
cell1
,
delimiter
,
cell2
)
Note:
Delimiters are spacing or symbols used to seperate content elements apart from each other.
Example of delimiters
comma ,    semicolon ;    quotes " or '    braces {}    pipes |    slashes / \
Info:
CONCAT is a new version of the old CONCATENATE function. Recent versions of Excel do not 
accept the old CONCATENATE function as it is only compatible with earlier versions of Excel. To use COCATENATE in the latest
versions of Excel, use CONCAT.
How to Use CONCAT Function
To combine values from multiple Excel cells, use
CONCAT
.
Note:
The different parts of the function are separated by a symbol, like comma
,
or semicolon
;
The symbol depends on your
Language Settings
.
Step 1)
Start the CONCAT function
Select a cell
E2

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=CONCAT
Double click the
CONCAT
command
Name	Type 1	Total stats
    Mankey	Fighting	305
    Poliwrath	Water	510
    Victreebel	Grass	490
    Tentacool	Water	335
    Magneton	Electric	465
    Dewgong	Water	475
    Cloyster	Water	525
    Onix	Rock	385
    Dragonair	Dragon	420
    Pidgeotto	Normal	349
    Rattata	Normal	253
    Beedrill	Bug	395
    Doduo	Normal	310
    Kingler	Water	475
    Nidoqueen	Poison	505
    Hitmonchan	Fighting	455
    Charmeleon	Fire	405
    Arbok	Poison	438
    Gastly	Ghost	310
    Magikarp	Water	200
Copy Values
Follow along the tutorial by trying it yourself!
Copy the values in the example above and try it on your own!
Step 2)
Link cells
Select a cell (
A2
)
Add a comma (
,
)
Add a space inside of quotation marks to create a delimiter (
" "
)
Select another cell (
A3
)
Hit enter
Note:
The
CONCAT
function does not provide any delimiters between cell values used 
  in the funtion. If you want your cell values to be displayed with delimiters, you have to add the delimiters between the
  selected cells. You can use any symbol as a demiliter, if you want the delimiter to be a space, enter
" "
.
The function returns the content of
A2
and
A3
separated with a
" "
dilimiter.
You can also use more symbols as a demilter, such as adding the word
" and "
.
The
CONCAT
function accepts cell values of both text and numbers, you can combine them in any way you prefer.
Combine the cell values with text strings as delimiters to make the output more descriptive!

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example of delimiters
content_sections.code: comma ,    semicolon ;    quotes " or '    braces {}    pipes |    slashes / \

quiz.question: What is CONCAT is a function in Excel and?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of CONCAT is a function in Excel and is 'short for concatenate'.

summary: This tutorial covers Excel CONCAT Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Excel CONCAT Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Excel CONCAT Function and how to apply it in your projects.
